page.title: 09A303-Through route & divider
page.content: This main road crosses the survey block east-west.Periodic improvements over the last 15 years have made it into a dual carriageway which can only be crossed or joined in one place.Its function within the national transport infrastructure is to carry people and goods speedily between London and the South West.Its effect however on this locale has been to act as a barrier both physically and mentally.To the north goods and services are centred on North Cadbury and Castle Cary while to the south Sherborne and Wincanton are the focal centres.The division north-south is also reflected in social activities.North Cadbury with its village hall and church provides a centre for bazaars,whist drives,flower festivals and amatuer dramatics for Woolston whereas Maperton is the centre for such events south of A303.
